alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 10:53AM CDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Little Minnesota River near Peever affecting Roberts County. Minnesota River near Big Stone Lake affecting Roberts, Grant and Big Stone Counties. Minnesota River at Ortonville affecting Big Stone County. North Fork Whetstone River near Milbank affecting Grant County. 12 Mile Creek near Wheaton affecting Traverse County. West Branch 12 Mile Creek At Dumont affecting Traverse County. 5 Mile Creek Near Herman affecting Traverse County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...5 Mile Creek Near Herman. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM CDT Friday was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 400 PM CDT.
